newsitem.title: USA: Kansas wheat harvest 97 percent complete.
newsitem.headline: Kansas wheat harvest 97 percent complete.

text.p: Harvesting of the Kansas wheat crop was nearly complete by Sunday, the state's agricultural statistics service said Monday in its weekly crop progress report.
Wheat harvesting was 97 percent complete, ahead of 88 percent last year and the five-year average of 84 percent.
Corn was 38 percent silked, against 49 percent last year and the average of 37 percent. Corn condition was rated 88 percent good to excellent, up slightly from 87 percent good to excellent last week.

Sorghum condition was reported 86 percent good to excellent, against 83 percent at that level last week. Fifteen percent of the sorghum was headed, ahead of seven percent last year and the average of three percent.

Soybean blooming was 42 percent complete, ahead of 30 percent last year and the average of 19 percent. Eighty-five percent of soybeans were in good to excellent condition, up from 81 percent at that level a week ago.

Pasture condition was rated 74 percent good or excellent, down from 82 percent a week earlier. Topsoil moisture condition was rated 13 percent surplus, 64 percent adequate, 19 percent short and four percent very short.
